availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James I. Hudnall (Pendleton County, Kentucky, hatter, postmaster, and attorney)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, hatter, postmaster, and attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Hudnall. Father of James W. Hudnall, Hester Hudnall, William K. Hudnall, Millard S. F. Hudnall, Sallie T. Hudnall, and E. J. Hudnall. Hatter in Clermont County, Ohio, in 1850. Postmaster in Falmouth, Kentucky, from January 6, 1851, to June 20, 1854. Attorney in Pendleton County in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain from October 8, 1861, to October 25, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Clermont County, Franklin Township District 22, p. 380A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Falmouth, p. 429.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Falmouth, p. 410A.
_ Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Pendleton County, Kentucky, Volume 14, p. 422 of 579 of microfilm.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 644-45.
